snippet: Sarah Robles, an American Olympian who received a two-year suspension after testing positive for a banned substance, said the test result was because of a hormonal precursor supplement.
abstract: Sarah Robles, American Olympian weight lifter who received two-year suspension after testing positive for a banned substance, says result was because of a hormonal precursor supplement sometimes used in the course of medical treatment for polycystic ovary syndrome.
lead_paragraph: Sarah Robles, an American Olympian who received a two-year suspension after testing positive for a banned substance, said the test result was because of a hormonal precursor supplement.
